paras.title: R-4B Seven-Thousand-Five-Hundred-Square-Foot One- and Two-Family Residence District.

content.text:
Purpose. The purpose of this district is to permit
one- and two-family homes on parcels of sufficient size to maintain
the suburban character of the neighborhoods, maintain usable yards
to avoid congestion created by insufficient off-street parking and
excessive traffic that results from two-family homes an undersized
lots and to assure that parcels for two-family home use are of sufficient
size to achieve these objectives.
Permitted principal uses.
Single-family dwelling.

Two-family dwelling on lots at least 7,500 square
feet.[Amended 5-8-2007; 8-28-2007; 8-24-2010]
Any municipal buildings or uses, regularly organized public, parochial or private elementary or second school in accordance with the requirements of § 280-55A(4).
Lot area and building requirements for principal uses.

Minimum lot area for one-family house: 6,500
square feet.[Amended 5-8-2007; 8-28-2007; 8-24-2010]

Minimum lot area for two-family house: 7,500
square feet.[Amended 5-8-2007; 8-28-2007; 8-24-2010]

Minimum lot width for one-family house: The
minimum lot width shall be 65 feet or the prevailing lot width, whichever
is greater.[Amended 5-8-2007; 8-28-2007; 8-24-2010]

Minimum lot width for two-family house: The
minimum lot width shall be 75 feet or the prevailing lot width, whichever
is greater.[Amended 5-8-2007; 8-28-2007; 8-24-2010]
Minimum lot frontage: 30 feet.

Front yard: The minimum front yard shall be
20 feet or the prevailing front yard setback, whichever is greater.[Amended 5-8-2007; 8-28-2007]
Minimum rear yard: 30 feet.
Minimum side yard: 10 feet each.[Amended 10-22-2002; 5-8-2007; 8-28-2007]
(Reserved)[1]

content.footnote:
[1]
Editor’s Note: Former Subsection B(9), regarding the
minimum aggregate width of both side yards, as amended, was repealed
8-24-2010.

content.text:
Minimum building size: 720 square feet of living
space for one-family house of which 576 square feet shall be on the
first floor; 600 square feet of living space per family for two-family
house.

Maximum height: 2 1/2 stories and in no
event to exceed 30 feet.[Amended 5-8-2007; 8-28-2007]
Maximum coverage: 25%.
No structure shall project outside the sky exposure plane specified at § 280-45R(2).[Added 5-8-2007; amended 8-28-2007]

The maximum interior floor area of a single-family
or two-family dwelling shall not exceed 1 1/2 times the maximum
lot coverage, as expressed in square feet.[Added 5-8-2007; amended 8-28-2007]
Permitted accessory uses. Same as for R-3 District.
Lot and building requirements for accessory uses.

Maximum height: one story, and in no event to
exceed 14 feet. Garages shall be one story, and in no event shall
exceed 14 feet to the ridgeline above surrounding grade; garages shall
be designed with a gabled roof.[Amended 6-28-2005]

Maximum land coverage: 10% (accessory building
or garage limited to 500 square feet).[Amended 6-28-2005]

Minimum distance to rear property line: three
feet.

Minimum distance to front property line: 65
feet.

Minimum distance to side property line: three
feet.[2]

content.footnote:
[2]
Editor's Note: Former Subsection E(6), establishing
minimum distance to corner side property line, which immediately followed
this subsection, was repealed 5-8-2007; 8-28-2007.

content.text:
Special uses permitted at the discretion of the Planning
Board. Same as for R-3 District.
Parking and loading.
Off-street parking requirements.
Two spaces for each dwelling unit.
Other uses: same as R-3 District.

The maximum number of garage doors and garage
parking spaces on a lot shall be two. The maximum floor area devoted
to garages on a lot shall be 500 square feet.[Added 5-8-2007; amended 8-28-2007]

Off-street loading requirements: same as for
R-3 District.
Prohibited uses.

Two-family dwelling occupying a lot less than
7,500 square feet.
Any uses not expressly permitted in this district.
